headline: Red Lobster Cheddar Biscuits
description: Red Lobster biscuits are loaded with Cheddar cheese and brushed with seasoned butter in this easy, no-knead copycat recipe that you can enjoy with any dinner.

video.description: Red Lobster biscuits are loaded with Cheddar cheese and brushed with seasoned butter in this easy copycat recipe video. No kneading is required — just drop the gently mixed batter directly onto a prepared baking sheet, and pop them in the oven.
video.name: How to Make Red Lobster Cheddar Biscuits

name: Red Lobster Cheddar Biscuits
recipeIngredient: 0.333 cup butter, softened and cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease or line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Stir flour, Cheddar cheese, baking powder, salt, and garlic powder together in a bowl.
Stir milk, softened butter pieces, and egg together in a separate bowl. Add to the flour mixture and stir until just combined and chunky, being very careful not to overmix.
Drop batter by tablespoonfuls onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, stir melted butter, parsley, and garlic powder together in a small bowl. Remove biscuits from the oven and brush melted butter mixture over top.
Return to the oven and bake until golden brown, about 5 more minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: Made it per spec, 1 1/2 recipe. Smaller portions perhaps then normal, could’ve used a bit more milk, made mine plain that might explain it. 375 Convection bake. 10 minutes then buttered (margarine then 5 minutes more. Perfect. Crispy outside and tender inside. Now to try variations. Thanks for an easy and wonderful keeper to the book.
These are amazing!! I added my left over cheese on top to bake, but that was my only change. Will definitely make these again!
These are really quick, easy and delicious. I like to add a teaspoon of Old Bay seasoning to mine. A really nice touch.
Followed the recipe to the t and the biscuits cam out a bit dry. Next time I think I'll add in more cheese and a little more milk.

I found the batter rarher moist. Did not make any significant changes but for the cheese since I did not have cheddar but Colby Jack. I made them for my Mother in law 85th dinner celebration. A great success. I finally found a great biscuit recipe that you can reheat. Will be making them often. There is no Red Lobster chain in my country. Thanks so much.

great recipe! i mixed the wet ingredients into the dry with my hands (leaving small chunks of butter), shaped the dough and folded it about 5-6 times before patting it out to about 1/2 inch thick. i cut out round biscuits and baked on a cookie sheet, then removed from the oven at 12 minutes. they were flaky, buttery and soft even before the melted butter mixture was brushed on them. whole family loved them!
Very tasty!

These are super easy to make with Bisquick! Then no baking powder or baking soda is required.Otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out great for Thanksgiving dinner - I typically make my biscuits from scratch but was too busy with everything else so wanted an easy biscuits recipe to sop up the gravy on that plate! Guests loved them.

We thought they were great! My suggestions are to use a rimmed baking sheet, so the butter is trapped, use parchment, and add more milk if the batter doesn’t come together. I live in a very dry climate and always need to add extra liquid to my recipes.
Temp needed to be higher..went to 375 and for additional 5 minutes. Made larger size as well
Turned out great
Very yummy

These were soooo dry. I don’t normally follow recipes but was super excited to try these and didn’t want to mess up. I followed each step and measurement. I pride myself on being able to adjust a recipe to make it better but other than completely restarting- there was nothing I could do to make these moist or flavorful.
Lovely rich taste. Crispy outside with soft center. Best cheddar bay biscuit recipe I have tasted.

I am sorry to have to say this but I was disappointed in the taste. I followed the recipe to a T but the biscuits did not have much flavor at all. I used sharp Chedder Cheese shredded and regular flour as stated in the recipe. I made sure not to mix the dry and wet ingredients too much as requested. Thank You for the recipe but I will not be making it again as there was no flavor to the biscuits. Thanks, Scarlet
These biscuits were very dry and salty. There aren’t enough wet ingredients for the amount of flour it calls for.
The whole family enjoyed this one. Mine needed to be slightly wetter. I would use sharp cheddar next time.
it made me feel good

Only my second attempt at homemade biscuits ever but I think it's a Pretty good recipe! Mine came out a bit dry but that might be because we only had oat milk on hand. I also read the comments and pinched my butter into the flour. Overall good flavor after I altered with some of my favorite spices and cut back on the salt a bit. Quick to make! I'll be trying this recipe again since I have some shredded cheddar that needs using up.
Well. I found Lobster Tails at my local market on sale. I found this recipe and tried it. Delicious.

My Husband made this recipe a few times he used different cheese blends and either way wether it be exactly like the recipe calls or using different cheeses love the recipe taste just like Red Lobster recommend this to anyone
Yummy!

Very simple recipe but I made some modifications based on other reviews. Added a tsp of sugar, chopped up the butter before mixing with the milk and egg, and included some Italian seasoning and garlic powder in the melted butter. I also used a tablespoon scoop and got closer to 2 dozen biscuits. Next time I will definitely use an extra sharp cheddar though. The texture was great but I only had medium cheddar and it made the biscuits less cheesy than I expected them to taste.

I could live off of these Red Lobster cheddar/garlic biscuits! I always bring some home when we eat there. But now I can get fat making and eating them at home! I put 2 cups of cheese and a little extra garlic because I'm EXTRA. Great copy-cat recipe.
I made these last night, and they were dry and just didn't taste right. I didn't have any bisquick, but i will stay with the tried and true of using the bisquick.
Great
If I added more garlic and cheese it would have been better but it's pretty good.
I added a little garlic powder and parsley to the melted butter wash. They were delicious!!
Love it
I thought they were very heavy and dry, also had to bake for 10 minutes longer than directions said, also the size of them 6 per the recipe instructions were huge!
10/10 would recommend

author.name: Sanity In A Sea Of Madness

review.reviewBody: I have issues with this recipe, but it's still worth 4/5 stars. The directions say it makes "6 servings", but the instructions say to drop the dough onto the cookie sheet by tablespoonfulls. It's easy to figure this out without being told - but the size of the biscuit affects the amount of time it takes to bake. I ended up with 7 biscuits that took 20 minutes. Tasted great! Along with the garlic powder in the melted butter, I added thinly-sliced green scallions to the batter. This is a keeper. Next time, I may try actual tablespoons of dough in one of those mini-muffin pans (24-count)
Made exactly to the recipe. Turned out great
I've always wanted to be able to make these at home and now I can with this amazing recipe!! they taste similar to the ones at Red Lobster band are easy to make.

Loved these! I made these for my son who loves Red Lobster biscuits. He said they were amazing. I did 1 tsp garlic and 1/2 tsp salt. Pack the chedder in the cup or add a little bit more. The garlic butter and parsley are a must after 10 minutes of baking then the additional 5 minutes worked perfect. I used a non stick cookie sheet and reduced oven to 375. The size of biscuits I made yielded 19. I will make these a lot!
Tasted really good. I'm glad I can use the items in my pantry and didn't need to buy bisquick mix.

great recipe, i only used 1/2 cup of cheddar cheese and a cup of parmesan cheese. i melted the butter before adding to milk and egg. next time i will use less salt. beef stew is my comfort food and these biscuits go perfectly. i wonder how they would taste with blue cheese

Found the recipe somewhat confusing. It said 6 biscuits so I decided to double recipe but I had enough for 20 + biscuits. The 1/3 c butter ? Pea size, melted, cubed? I cut in small pieces but would have liked better instructions. Found 10 min baking was not enough. But after all this ... biscuits were tasty.
We made this recipe and it turned out just like the ones you get at Red Lobster! Loved it!

These are amazing! They're so easy to make and turned out really well. Some reviewers said it was too salty, so we used half the amount of salt, which was great. Ours needed about 8 minutes after brushing with butter before turning golden brown.

Was not sure about the butter in step 3.
I melted it.
If you drop by rounded tablespoons you will get around 15 biscuits.
I brushed with butter and fresh chopped parsley after 10 mins then finished baking.
I always use unsalted butter for those who think they are salty.
I might taste the baking powder a bit.
Don’t skimp on the cheese.
There was too much flour and/or not enough butter and garlic to match the restaurant version.
It tasted AWESOME! I would recommend more cheese , but it still tasted good with less cheese.
Love this recipe. It make a good 8 biscuits.
So easy to make. Next time I will reduce the salt slightly. Didn't add the butter baste at the end... still amazing!
Easy and quick receipe. Paired with bean and ham soup homemade. I didn’t have garlic powder so I put minced cloves in the topping butter. Turned out great !
Quick and easy. Everyone loved, especially the hubs. Winner!
Me and my family loved it!!

Delicious! So easy to make and they turn out perfectly every time, way better than the ones Red Lobster serves. Be sure you add a sprinkle of garlic powder to the melted butter, it adds that extra something. I sprinkle mine with Italian seasoning before putting back in the oven.
Very Good!! Will definitely make them again.
I added a bit of parsley and additional garlic powder to the melted butter to my taste

I followed the recipe and baking time. I checked a biscuit and it seemed undercooked. I baked them another 4 minutes. They were too dry. I probably should have taken them out at 10 minutes. Not as flavorful as Red Lobsters'.

Great recipe! One thing I did was added a 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg to the mixture. I also baked them at 400 for 10 minutes then brushed butter on them and sprinkled parsley flakes on them then back in the oven for 13 more minutes. Nice rise to them.
These were a big hit!

This is great! And there's a simpler way that works beautifully--use Southern Biscuit Formula L according to the directions on the bag and add the cheese. In fact, I recommend that particular biscuit mix over anything I've been able to do from scratch and it's really easy.
These turned out great! I just put the parsley in the mix vs on top.

This was an awesome recipe. We didn’t have shredded cheddar, so we used a ‘Mexican’ four cheese blend, and it was delicious. I mixed in the half a teaspoon of garlic powder into the butter to brush on top, and it was perfect. Absolutely making this again.

These were very good, a little heavier than the restaurant Red Lobster and heavier than their mix you can buy at the store but I liked these because I can use all organic ingredients. Instead of putting the melted butter with parsley on halfway through baking I put it on once out of the oven but still piping hot, just like the Red Lobster box mix tells you. I also think that you could easily get 8 biscuits out of this recipe, I thought the biscuits were too big, I ended up splitting them in halves for the kids. Will make again!

Used adobo light instead of salt and added some chives and Italian seasoning instead of parsley into the butter mixture brushed on towards the end. Will happily make again this really only took 25 minutes with prep it was great!
delicous

Great recipe. They tasted awesome. I added two cups of cheese instead of one. Such great taste and soft. I had to add an additional five minutes when I added the melted butter and garlic powder because they didn’t looked cooked, so I cooked 10 minutes, took out to add the butter and garlic, and then cooked for 10 minutes.
These are almost just like what they serve at Red Lobster. Will definitely be making these again.
Doubled the recipe and they turned out amazing!!!!

I loved the recipe so much, it tasted and smelled exactly the same as Red Lobster®. I added a bit more salt to it and the garlic butter was mouth watering. With using just the recipe I make 24 biscuits using a small ice cream scoop instead of a tablespoon sized portion.

I followed the recipe to the exact measure. For ingredients I used sharp cheese. I, too, had to cook biscuits more than 5 minutes after brushing with butter (next time i will include a little garlic).

I would be careful with the salt, perhaps cut back a bit as it was a tasty salty for me. For butter I used unsalted butter.

I would definitely make these again with the following changes:

Reduce salt by 1/2
Add a little more Sharp Cheddar 
Brush tops with melted butter "and" garlic
Watch closely when baking beyond 5 minutes after brushing tops to avoid bottoms getting too hard

In addition to my review (below)--- i wanted to add that this yields WAY more than 6 biscuits. I wound up with 16 biscuits using a big rounded tablespoon to plop then (a bit larger than a golf ball when raw). 
-----------------------------------------------
Delicious recipe. Added a little less salt in the initial recipe only to add some salt into the (already salted) butter I used to dress the tops at the 10 minute mark. Definitely add the garlic powder/parsley to the butter to dress the tops as well. Timing was just right. Would love to give it another go where I put the butter into the flour first and then the cheese and wet ingredients - as well as adding other treasures like chives/bacon.
These biscuits are awesome! My son said he'd give them 6 out of 5 stars. Next time, I think I will add a little extra salt as I miss that from the actual Red Lobster biscuits.
I thought they were very good but next time I make them I’ll add a little less garlic. I thought it over powered the taste and I like garlic.

These were good. I used whole wheat flower and replace milk with sour cream because I didn’t have the ingredients. The flavour was good, easy to make. After putting the butter on top towards the end, I found I had to keep the biscuits in for about 10 mins to get browned. Overall pretty good and I will make again!

Absolutely delicious and turned out great! These taste very much like the original and are so flaky and fluffy! Everyone is different, so you might want to adjust a few ingredients to your taste; I brushed extra butter on top for a flaky, buttery sensation! I will be definitely making these again, a savory treat for the whole family!
It's so Goooooooooooooooood
yes

Used an air fryer for 1/2 the batch and baked it at 400f for 10 min. I used a small oven for the 2nd half and it took much longer to cook. Melted the butter before combining with milk and eggs and also added a little garlic powder into the melted butter to put on top of the biscuits.

Really good and incredibly easy. Was looking for one that I could just use flour with and that didn't require a baking mix. Did not make any changes except put on the broiler at the very end so the tops got crisped a little better. Had with chilli.
I made these buns...

Delicious. I grated the cheese and butter into the dry ingredients before adding the milk. I omitted the egg and added a bit of plain yogurt because that’s the way I make my regular biscuits. I will definitely make these again.

These were very simple to make and absolutely delicious! All 4 of my young children loved them and so did my husband—-a win!—-just out of personal Maryland preference I brushed the top with butter and old bay.

My family loved these with our beef stew. I made about 2 dozen and they were all gone by the end of dinner!!!

I will make these every time we have soup or stews for supper!!
Made the recipe and the biscuits were delicious. Super easy!

These are so good I doubled the recipe. 
I also used a pastry cutter to cut hard butter into about 1/2 the dry flour mixture before adding the liquids and cheese. This worked out very well.
I live on the west coast now (in Canada) and Red Lobster do not have their restaurants here, but I remember these biscuits.
This was awesome. Enjoyed it. Used 1/2 teaspoon of salt and added 1/2 teaspoon of onion powder.

This was a hit with my family! I substituted 1/4 C. canola oil for the fat, mixing that into the egg, then adding the milk to that before pouring into the dry ingredients. It came together well (with about 1/4 C. extra flour). I put 12 good-sized dough pieces on a silicone mat to bake. They needed about 15-16 minutes in the oven to brown (but they were pretty large). I brushed them with butter (with garlic and parsley) when I removed the biscuits from the oven. 
 This is an easy recipe to stir together by hand (especially using oil) and it was very good. I'll be making this again!
These were waaaay too salty.
No changes and they were the BEST! I did put dry ingredients in a bowl and “cut in” the butter. Added the cheese, then eggs and milk. Stirred just enough to combine and followed recipe from there.

I made a minor change to this recipe. One of the reviewers mentioned cutting the cold butter into the flour first, then adding the other ingredients as written. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly, including bake time. I made sure to use the cook's notes for brushing garlic and parsley butter over the top and it clinched the deal! My husband loved these. We had recently been to Red Lobster and he thought my biscuits were even better. I will definitely be making this recipe again.

I made these for supper tonight and my husband and I both loved them. I did need to add just a touch more milk as my dough was too dry for some reason. I used both the garlic and parsley in the butter on top. Will definitely be making these again!!
I cooked mine with fiesta cheese and in a muffin pan. Delicious!

Always loved these biscuits. Made them from the box mix which called for 3/4 cups water. Replaced the water with beer. Added a little more freeze dried parsley and 2 pinches of Old Bay seasoning to the melted butter. YUM! Great accompaniment to soup, stew, chowder. Add a Bloody Mary....great little dinner!

Those saying its too salty are wrong. I wonder if they used garlic salt instead of garlic powder...BIG difference and they are not interchangeable. Really very good but not quite as good as Red Lobster.
Yum! A good bread solution in this no-yeast-to-be-bought coronarirus world we are now living in!
It was easy to follow and taste awesome!!!
these are the very best. I used three quarter cups milk instead of half. Really yummy.. I have been making drop biscuits for years these are the best ever. I cantvgive them enough stars.
Maybe it's my oven, but I had to cook for 10 minutes longer to brown them. A bit salty for my taste, but could be the butter I chose too. I'm not sure if I'll make this recipe again.
IT WAS AMAZING. its was so good my family had some
The biscuits were pretty dry and I had to add more garlic to the butter on top. I would add more salt, garlic, and milk (maybe even half and half) to the batter.
Yummy, i will make this again, i will leave off the butter topping

Amazing! I did pinch the butter into the flour mixture and then added the wet ingredients. I also did garlic salt and some chives in the melted butter for the topping. I think these are better than Red Lobster’s!

I love it BUT there is something missing with the butter. If you make as the recipe says you're putting a huge chunk of butter in the milk...??? Not sure if it's supposed to be softened or melted but....!!!
They came out almost exactly like the restaurant, just a little fluffier. :)
